content: There are different factors that can contribute to the decline of some industries while others experience growth in a metropolitan area. In the case of manufacturing, for example, some businesses may have moved operations overseas in search of cheaper labor and production costs. The decline of coal mining can be attributed to a shift towards cleaner and more sustainable sources of energy as well as a decrease in demand. As for retail, the rise of e-commerce has disrupted the traditional brick-and-mortar model, leading to closures of physical stores. On the other hand, industries such as healthcare, technology, and finance have thrived due to advancements in technology, changing consumer preferences, and increases in demand for their services.
